data.enText: a long thin mark or line that is a different colour from the surface it is on
streaks of grey in her hair
dirty streaks on the window
a part of a person's character, especially an unpleasant part
a ruthless/vicious/mean streak
data.chText: 冷酷 / 邪恶 / 卑鄙的性格

data.enText: a streak of cruelty
a series of successes or failures, especially in a sport or in gambling
data.chText: （尤指体育比赛或赌博中）顺的时候，背的时候，运气，手气

data.enText: a streak of good luck
to hit (= have) a winning streak
to be on a winning/losing streak
data.chText: 赶上顺的 / 背的时候

data.enText: a lucky/unlucky streak
data.chText: 运气好 / 不好的阶段

data.enText: to mark or cover sth with streaks
data.chText: 在…上画条纹（或留下条痕）；使布满条纹（或条痕）

data.enText: Tears streaked her face.
His face was streaked with mud.
data.chText: 他脸上满是一条条的污泥。

data.enText: She's had her hair streaked (= had special chemicals put on her hair so that it has attractive coloured lines in it) .
to move very fast in a particular direction
A car pulled out and streaked off down the road.
data.chText: 一辆汽车驶出后沿着公路疾驰而去。

data.enText: to run through a public place with no clothes on as a way of getting attention

data.text: mark ♦ stain ♦ streak ♦ speck ♦ blot ♦ smear ♦ spot

data.enText: These are all words for a small area of dirt or another substance on a surface.
data.chText: 以上各词均指污点、斑点、污迹。

data.enText: mark
a small area of dirt or other substance on the surface of sth, especially one that spoils its appearance
The kids left dirty marks all over the kitchen floor.
data.chText: 孩子们把厨房的地板弄得污迹斑斑。

data.enText: stain
a dirty mark on sth that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid
blood stains
streak
a long thin mark or line that is a different colour from the surface it is on
She had streaks of grey in her hair.
speck
a very small mark, spot or piece of a substance on sth
There isn't a speck of dust anywhere in the house.
blot
a spot or dirty mark left on sth by a substance such as ink or paint being dropped on a surface
smear
a mark made by sth such as oil or paint being spread or rubbed on a surface
spot
a small dirty mark on sth
There were grease spots all over the walls.
a streak/speck/blot/smear/spot of sth
a dirty mark/stain/streak/speck/smear/spot
an ink mark/stain/blot/spot
a(n) oil/grease/paint mark/stain/spot
to leave a mark/stain/streak/speck/blot/smear/spot
to get a mark/stain/spot out of sth

word_means: 顺的时候，背的时候，运气，手气

means: (尤指体育比赛或赌博中)顺的时候，背的时候，运气，手气
在…上画条纹(或留下条痕)

tr: a narrow marking of a different color or texture from the background
example: a green toad with small black stripes or bars
may the Stars and Stripes forever wave
had a streak of bad luck
Nicklaus had a run of birdies

tr: mark with spots or blotches of different color or shades of color as if stained
run naked in a public place
move quickly in a straight line
example: The plane streaked across the sky

example.ex: There are these dark streaks on the surface of the moon...
example.tran: 月球表面有这样一些黑色的条痕。

example.ex: The flames begin as a few streaks of red against the pale brown of the walls.
example.tran: 火焰燃起时，犹如几条红色条纹映衬在淡褐色的墙上。

value.def: A streak is a long stripe or mark on a surface which contrasts with the surface because it is a different colour.

example.ex: Rain had begun to streak the windowpanes...
example.tran: 雨水已经开始在窗玻璃上冲出道道条痕。

example.ex: Fine shades of grey streaked his dark hair...
example.tran: 他的黑发间有几丝白发。

example.ex: His face was pale and streaked with dirt.
example.tran: 他脸色苍白，脸上有一道道的污痕。

value.def: If something streaks a surface, it makes long stripes or marks on the surface.
value.tran: 在…上留下条纹(或条痕);使布满条纹(或条痕)

example.ex: Her bare feet were dirt-streaked and cracked with cold.
example.tran: 她赤裸的双脚上满是一道道的泥污，都冻得开裂了。
车身上满是道道煤烟灰痕的银色火车

example.ex: We're both alike—there is a streak of madness in us both...
He's still got a mean streak.

value.def: If someone has a streak of a particular type of behaviour, they sometimes behave in that way.

example.ex: A meteorite streaked across the sky...
He got a near perfect start, streaking away from the pack.
example.tran: 他的起跑近乎完美，迅速从那群人中蹿了出去。

value.def: If something or someone streaks somewhere, they move there very quickly.

example.ex: The casinos had better watch out since I'm obviously on a lucky streak!
example.tran: 很明显我现在手气正旺，赌场最好当心了！

example.ex: ...a losing streak that had extended back to June 1.
example.tran: 从 6 月 1 日开始就频频失利

value.def: A winning streak or a lucky streak is a continuous series of successes, for example in gambling or sport. A losing streak or an unlucky streak is a series of failures or losses.
value.tran: (赌博或体育比赛等中的)运气，手气
